H0.text: which philosopher advocated the idea of return to nature. Jean-Jacques Rousseau

H1.text: which philosopher advocated the idea of return to nature. Henry David Thoreau

H2.text: which philosopher advocated the idea of return to nature. John Locke

H3.text: which philosopher advocated the idea of return to nature. Bacon

A4.text: Rousseau claimed that the state of nature was a primitive condition without law or morality, which human beings left for the benefits and necessity of cooperation.

A5.text: All three thinkers had believed that humans living without central authority were facing uncertain conditions in a state of mutual competition.
